page.title: 08A Headmaster's Schooldays
page.content: When I went to school as a boy in a Lancashire cotton town we were taught as a class.Very little attention was given to individual needs.The class was judged on its performance as a whole and not as individual children in that class. The teacher was also judged on the performance of the class. Today,a child's progress is charted carefully throughout his/her time in school.Social needs are considered and placed in context with the learning process,so that progress through school is carefully monitored. Relationships between children and teachers have altered tremendously and it would be true to say that children today look forward to school more so than twenty years ago. Teachers and children are partners in the learning process.
